meta.@content: Camera, CameraShot and CameraMove examples that demonstrate storyboard capabilities and precise camera operation. This is a developmental effort for potential X3D Specification improvement.

Two demos are found in the scene, click the "red text"on left or right to start. (a) SimpleShotsTest shows Zoom in/out, Pan left/right, Boom up/down, Tilt left/right, with each is defined by a CameraShot collecting a series of CameraMovements. (b) AimPointTest gradually slews the camera view to look at the sliding cube, then follows it around before returning to original viewpoint.
Schematron rules, backed up by initialize() checks
Camera nodes for Viewpoint navigation control

-children.#comment: TODO warn if more than one identifier present

initialize clock to match totalDuration of combined Shot Moves

================ CrossHair visualization for center of screen ================
turn on CrossHairInstance when animated camera viewpoints are bound

turn off CrossHairInstance when animated camera viewpoints are unbound <BooleanFilter DEF='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='isBound' fromNode='Camera.SimpleShotsTest' toField='set_boolean' toNode='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='isBound' fromNode='Camera.AimPointTest' toField='set_boolean' toNode='NegateCrossHair'/> <ROUTE fromField='inputNegate' fromNode='NegateCrossHair' toField='set_enabled' toNode='CrossHairInstance'/>
